basics.name: Haonan Wang
basics.label: Master Student
basics.summary: Master student at Johns Hopkins University.

work.name: Cancer Dynamics Lab, The Francis Crick Institute
work.summary: Developing a pipeline for automatic segmentation and position calculation of cells in multiplexed fluorescence microscopy.

work.name: Electron Microscopy Science Technology Platform, The Francis Crick Institute
work.summary: Developing napari plugins and developing machine learning models for the automated analysis of volume electron microscopy images.

work.name: School of Biological & Behavioural Sciences, Queen Mary University of London
work.summary: Learning to use a range of bioinformatics and computational tools to process and analyse large amounts of DNA sequence data

awards.title: The Pathological Society Undergraduate Elective Bursary
awards.summary: Recipient of the Pathological Society Undergraduate Bursary which funded a six-week long research placement in the Cancer Dynamics Lab in the Francis Crick Institute.
